name: flour
content:

B1 powder made from grain, especially wheat, used for making bread, cakes, pasta, pastry, etc.: Thicken the sauce with a little flour. Do you prefer flour or corn tortillas? See also
all-purpose flour
plain flour
self-raising flour
self-rising flour
RogerDixon/DorlingKindersley/GettyImages
soft powder made from the seeds or roots of a plant that often contains a lot of starch (= a substance found in potatoes, rice, etc.), used in cooking : These Vietnamese pancakes are made of rice flour, and so thin you can read a newspaper through them. You can substitute wheat flour with almond flour in cakes, cookies and muffins. coconut/chickpea/tapioca flour See also
cornflour UK
gram flour
More examplesFewer examplesIn a large bowl, mix together the flour, sugar and raisins in a bowl.To make the pastry, sieve the flour and salt into a mixing bowl.I buy unbleached flour from the local health food store.Gently work the butter into the flour until there are no lumps left.High in protein and healthy fat, almond flour is a good substitute for wheat flour.Potato flour makes light and airy dinner rolls.
